title: Make the Leading Coefficient "1"
text: We can divide both side by $$5$$ and get $$y^2-25=0$$.
speech: We can divide both side by  5  and get  y squared, minus 25 is equal to 0 .
pacedSpeech: We can divide both side by   5
and get   y squared, minus 25 is equal to 0

title: Isolate the Quadratic Term
text: We add $$25$$ to both sides to get $$y^2$$ by itself which gives $$y^2=25$$.
speech: We add  25  to both sides to get  y squared  by itself which gives  y squared is equal to 25 .
pacedSpeech: We add   25
to both sides to get   y squared
by itself which gives   y squared is equal to 25

title: Use Square root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$. $$y^2=25$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$y=\sqrt{25}$$ or $$y=-\sqrt{25}$$.

speech: Simplify  minus the square root of 25 .

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$5y^2-125=0$$ has two solutions which are $$y=-5$$ and $$y=5$$.
speech: Therefore,  5 y squared, minus 125 is equal to 0  has two solutions which are  y, is equal to, negative 5  and  y, is equal to 5 .
